medi:segment.name: Beginning of message
medi:segment.medi:documentation: BGM, A segment for unique identification of the Inventory Report document, name and its number.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment enabling the specification of coded information or free text information relevant to the whole message. In computer to computer exchange such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to identify the date at which the inventory report was issued.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments giving references and where necessary, their dates relating to the whole message, e.g., a contract, dispatch advice number, etc.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents relating to the whole inventory report message, e.g., a contract, dispatch advice number, etc.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the referred document.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying names, addresses and locations relevant to the whole message.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment for identifying names and addresses and their functions relevant for the whole Inventory Report. Indications of the parties involved is recommended for the Inventory Report message. They are to be given in the NAD segment. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information in addition to the address specified in the NAD segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments giving references only relating to the specified party, rather than the whole message.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents and other numbers pertinent to the party identified in the NAD segment.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the referred document.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to identify person, function, department, and where appropriate numbers to which the communications should be directed.

medi:segment.name: Contact information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CTA, A segment to identify person, function, department, to whom communications should be directed.

medi:segment.name: Communication contact
medi:segment.medi:documentation: COM, Identifying communication types and numbers for the entities specified in CTA, e.g., FAX, TELEX, telephone, etc.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to indicate currencies used for financial evaluation.

medi:segment.name: Currencies
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CUX, A segment specifying currencies, and, if required, rates of exchange for the whole message, e.g., evaluation currency.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the currencies.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments providing details of all package levels of the inventory report. This segment group provides the capability to give the hierarchical relationship. The group defines a local top-down packaging structure.

medi:segment.name: Consignment packing sequence
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CPS, A segment identifying the sequence in which packing has been done, e.g. handling unit (pallet), package (box).

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments identifying packaging, marks and numbers, date and time information.

medi:segment.name: Package
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number and type of packages. DE7224, number of packages must not be used.

medi:segment.name: Package identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC Segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments providing package quantities with package identification and relevant date/time information.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QTY, A segment to provide quantity information suitably qualified for the packages referred to in the PAC Segment, e.g., opening quantity, closing quantity, adjustment quantity. This quantity segment may contain any number of packages.

medi:segment.name: Goods identity number
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GIN, A segment to provide serial-, batch-, label- or packaging number. These may be simple numbers or ranges of numbers.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time period relevant to the package, e.g. production date, expiration date, etc.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 9: SG11 A group of segments providing detailed information on each line of the inventory report.

medi:segment.name: Line item
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LIN, A segment identifying a specific line item in the inventory report. All other segments in the detail section refer to the line item.

medi:segment.name: Additional product id
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PIA, A segment to allow the transmission of additional product identification.

medi:segment.name: Item description
medi:segment.medi:documentation: IMD, A segment for describing the item.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment enabling the specification of the manufacturer of a line item.

medi:segment.name: Measurements
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of the inventory item, either in original or packaged form.

medi:segment.name: Additional information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the line item is subject to special conditions due to origin custom preference or commercial factors.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment indicating details regarding specific place or location of the specified line item.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the line item.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment enabling the specification coded or free text information relevant to a line item. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments giving references only relating to the specified line item.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents and other numbers pertinent to the line item.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the referred document.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 11: SG15 A group of segments providing quantity, and optionally package details, line item currencies and references.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QTY, A segment to provide quantity information, suitably qualified for the product referred to by the LIN segment, e.g., opening quantity, closing quantity, etc.

medi:segment.name: Inventory management related details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: INV, A segment identifying all the parameters required for a full stock activity report.

medi:segment.name: Goods identity number
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GIN, A segment to provide specific serial, batch or packaging numbers to which the specific quantity relates. These may be single numbers or ranges of numbers.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment indicating details regarding specific place or location of the quantity referred to in QTY.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the quantity.

medi:segment.name: Status
medi:segment.medi:documentation: STS, A segment giving transport status report, e.g., damaged, customs refusal and totally missing.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 12: A segment group to identify the owner of the inventory.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the owner of the stock.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, To identify a country/place/location/related location one/related location two.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments to provide price/cost/value information.

medi:segment.name: Price details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PRI, A segment to provide the price/cost/value, suitable qualified.

medi:segment.name: Currencies
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CUX, A segment specifying currencies, and if required, rates of exchange, e.g., evaluation currency.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the currencies.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments giving references only relating to the specified quantity.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents and other numbers pertinent to the quantity.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the referred document.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments providing details of all package levels item or quantity. This segment group provides the capability to give the hierarchical relationship. The group defines a logical top-down packaging structure.

medi:segment.name: Consignment packing sequence
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CPS, A segment identifying the sequence in which packing has been done, e.g., handling unit (pallet), package (box).

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments specifying the number and type of packages, identification of the packages and date/time information.

medi:segment.name: Package
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number and type of packages (physical units and the physical type of packaging).

medi:segment.name: Measurements
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurement of packages / physical units described in the PAC segment.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
QTY, A segment to specify the quantity per package described in the PAC segment.
If the QTY segment of Segment Group 16 is used, and if and only if, the next segment to be used is the QTY tigger of Segment Group 11 (i.e. with no intervening segments being used), then Segment Group 17 must be used before returning to Segment Group 11, in order to prevent segment collision.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 17: A segment group specifying markings, labels and packing.

medi:segment.name: Package identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and / or labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing the package identification e.g. master label number.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period relevant to the package, e.g., production date, expiration date, etc.

medi:segment.name: Goods identity number
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GIN, A segment to provide serial, batch, label or packaging number. These may be simple numbers or ranges of numbers.
